title: How to Measure for Blinds

steps.headline: Be sure to measure accurately.
steps.description: If the window is set in a deep recess, fitting the blind inside makes for a neat finish. But mistakes in measurements can ruin them altogether.

steps.headline: Measure for width.
steps.description: Measure the width of the recess in three places: at the top, at the middle, and at the bottom. Make sure you hold both ends of the tape on the inside edges of the recess. Note the smallest measurement, as it will be the one you use.

steps.headline: Measure for height.
steps.description: Measure the height of the window recess three times: at the left, in the center, and at the right. Make sure you hold both ends of the tape on the inside edges of the recess. Note the longest measurement, as it will be the one you use.

steps.headline: Determine where the mount will be.
steps.description: It should be placed 1 ⁄2 to 3 inches (3.8 to 7.6 cm) above the  window.

steps.headline: Measure for height.
steps.description: Measure from the proposed location of the mount down to 2–4 inches (5.1–10.2 cm) below the bottom of the window. This extra overlap is to block out light and ensure privacy.

steps.headline: Measure for width.
steps.description: For the width of any set of blinds, carefully measure the width of the window and add between 2 and 4 inches on each side.

For the width of any set of blinds, carefully measure the width of the window and add between 2 and 4 inches on each side.
